channel.title: Could torches be causing the lag?
channel.description:
Could torches be causing the lag?
Ive noticed that most of the land around the UN and my island it now torched to keep mobs away. As more torches are being added Ive noticed more people getting more laggy. Now as I'm building a new project that uses alot of torches some player cant even travel down my road. Could the chunk loading of so many torches be causing this lag for players?

item.title: Could torches be causing the lag?
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

it could be possible. our city has over 20 stacks of torches in it. and thats alot of torches

Read full topic
item.source: Could torches be causing the lag?

item.title: Could torches be causing the lag?
item.dc:creator: @deathwilldie0 deathwilldie0
item.description:
@deathwilldie0 wrote:

i didn’t even think of lag when putting down the torches. If need be i’ll remove them since i placed them. I know that the lag was happening before the torchs but i’m sure the torches don’t help it.

Read full topic
item.source: Could torches be causing the lag?

item.title: Could torches be causing the lag?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ll get on again soon and see what the problem is. Last time there was lag it was due to map corruption, which I fixed by running that ‘chunkster’ program. I know what to look for in the server log now.

Read full topic
item.source: Could torches be causing the lag?

item.title: Could torches be causing the lag?
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

Usually lighting changes cause lag. But I’ve never had any problem with fps or network lag on the server.

Read full topic
item.source: Could torches be causing the lag?
